description:
Solanum tuberosum, commonly known as the potato, is a flowering plant species in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is an herbaceous perennial plant, typically grown for its starchy, edible tubers.

The potato plant has a stem that grows above ground, with leaves, flowers, and fruit. The underground stems produce the tubers, which are the edible portion of the plant. The tubers can vary in size, shape, and color, ranging from round to oblong, and from white to yellow, red, blue, or purple.

Potatoes are an important food crop, providing a rich source of carbohydrates, vitamins, and minerals. They are widely cultivated around the world, with a global production of over 300 million metric tons annually. Potatoes can be prepared in various ways, such as boiling, baking, frying, or mashing, and are a staple food in many cuisines.
prompt: Provide a short scientific description of this species
